main event: Several UFO sightings were reported in Moscow and Dniepropetrovsk in the summer of 1949, including an observation of a telephone pole-like object with rotating balls at an altitude of 15,000 feet, and a large disk with a flaming arch and sparks emerging from its edge seen over the southern perimeter from East to West.
interesting points: The source observed a large disk with a flaming arch and sparks emerging from its edge, which seemed to be related to the 'flying saucer' scare in the U.S. at the time.
The observation was reported to have lasted for 10-15 seconds, with the object appearing to hover at high speeds and being seen on multiple occasions.
The attention of Russian and German workers was attracted to the object, and discussions could not find an answer to its nature.
The object had spherical items arranged above a vertical rod, which remained motionless for about 10 minutes before moving away.
An interrogator noted that a similar object was seen by Allied pilots over Germany towards the end of World War II, indicating a historical precedence for the sighting.
